description: Before everyone takes out trash, there are 100 units of trash in the house.
Luke wanted to take out 50 units of trash, and took out 35 units.

The conversation is about the residents of an apartment building discussing and agreeing to work together to distribute the trash management load more evenly, aiming for 12-15 units of trash per person per month, and proposing to keep track of their progress and adjust as needed.
conversation: Landlord

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly trash report. John took out 20 units of trash. Kate took out 10 units of trash. Jack took out 25 units of trash. Emma took out 10 units of trash. Luke took out 35 units of trash.
John

Hey everyone, thanks for the update. I'm a bit surprised to see Luke took out 35 units of trash. I understand we all have our own strategies, but I'm starting to feel like I'm taking out more than my fair share. Would anyone be open to discussing a more balanced approach to trash management? Maybe we can find a way to distribute the load more evenly and save some time in the long run.
Kate

Hey John, I completely understand your concern. I took out 10 units of trash this month, and I'm not thrilled about it either. I think it's a great idea to discuss a more balanced approach. I've been thinking about it, and I think we could aim to take out around 15-20 units of trash per person per month. That way, we can all contribute equally and avoid having one person take on too much. What do you think, guys? Do you have any thoughts on this?
Emma

I think Kate's suggestion of aiming for 15-20 units of trash per person per month is a great starting point. I've been thinking about this too, and I agree that it would be beneficial to distribute the load more evenly. However, I'm a bit concerned that 15-20 units might be a bit too high for me. I took out 10 units this month, and I'm not sure I can increase that by 5-10 units. Would it be possible to aim for a slightly lower target, like 12-15 units per person, and then reassess and adjust as needed?
